title: NGS Cleanup with AMPure Magnetic Beads
author: Opentrons
description:
With this protocol, you can perform nucleic acid purifications that are similar to the NGS Cleanup and Size Selection with Omega Bio-Tek Mag-Bind TotalPure found in the Opentrons Protocol Library with slight modifications.
Updates to this protocol:

A second trough for ethanol (column 2 and 3)
Three troughs for liquid waste (columns 10, 11, and 12)
Longer incubation and drying times
Manual pause/resume steps after ethanol wash steps




P50 Multi-channel electronic pipette (preferred, see Additional Notes below)
50/300uL Opentrons Tipracks
Opentrons Magnetic Module
Bio-Rad Hard Shell 96-well PCR plate 200ul #hsp9601
USA Scientific 12-channel reservoir 22ml #1061-8150
MagBeads (AMPure)
Ethanol
Elution Buffer (nuclease-free water)



Slot 1: Opentrons Magnetic Module with Bio-Rad plate, containing samples
Slot 2: Bio-Rad plate, clean and empty (for elution)
Slot 3: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
Slot 4: Empty
Slot 5: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
Slot 6: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
Slot 7: 12-Channel Reservoir, loaded (columns):
 1: MagBeads
 2: Ethanol
 3: Ethanol
 4-9: Not Used
 10: Empty (for Liquid Waste)
 11: Empty (for Liquid Waste)
* 12: Empty (for Liquid Waste)
Slot 8: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
Slot 9: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
Slot 10: 50/300uL Opentrons Tiprack
process:
Input your protocol parameters.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support articles.
Hit "Run".
notes:
Note about pipettes: This protocol involves volume transfers below 30ul. Because of this, the P50-Multi and the P50-Single are highly recommended. The P300 pipettes can be used, but we cannot guarantee the accuracy of the aforementioned transfers.
If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact the Protocol Development Team by filling out the Troubleshooting Survey.
